title: problem reusing old install after updating spack to v0.13.0
body:
I installed mpich 3.3 (hash `diz4f6i`) back in April and have been using it since without any problems to install other packages that depend on MPI.  After switching to version v0.13.0, when I try to reuse the mpich install the concretization wants to reinstall mpich3.3.  Please excuse my abuse of spack terminology.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

To sanity check what I was seeing I moved to my arch linux workstation and a fresh/empty spack instance.

The following steps will install mpich 3.3 using a spack commit from around April, then switch to the v0.13.0 release and attempt to use the mpich 3.3 install to install p4est.

```
cd /path/to/spack/source
export SPACK_ROOT=$PWD
export PATH=$SPACK_ROOT/bin:$PATH
source $SPACK_ROOT/share/spack/setup-env.sh
git checkout 263d8a818
spack install mpich@3.3
spack find -ldv mpich@3.3 # get the hash
git checkout v0.13.0
spack spec -I p4est ^/<mpich3.3 hash>
```
